Bibliographic References: Gabriella Prisco, A.I.O.N. 7, 1985, p. 139, no. 4, fig. 43, 0
Imagery Description: (a) Eros with cista and fillet, (a) youth.
Additional Notes: The vase is known to m e only from the illustration of the obverse in Prisco's article; she associates it with other vases from the workshop of Asteas and Python, and the Eros is very similar in treatment, especially in regard to the wings, to the one on no. 98; the groundNon Sepcifiedlines and dividing palmettes also correspond. T h e lid was found with a bowl (inv. 38129) but, according to Prisco, the two do not belong together.
